titleStmt.title: A true relation of the Scots taking of Cocket Iland: where they have taken The garison. The governour. 70 officers and souldiers. 7 peeces of ordnance. All their ammunition. And have placed there a garison of their own men. And of their proceedings at the siege at Newcastle, and their propositions sent to Col. Glenham, to deliver up Newcastle to them, and Col. Glenhams answer to it. With other passages concerning the Sheelds and Tinmouth Castle, and other proceedings made known to Parliament Februarie 12, 1644. By Col. Curfet, Commander in the Scots armie.
titleStmt.author: Curfet, Colonel.

titleStmt.title: A true relation of the Scots taking of Cocket Iland: where they have taken The garison. The governour. 70 officers and souldiers. 7 peeces of ordnance. All their ammunition. And have placed there a garison of their own men. And of their proceedings at the siege at Newcastle, and their propositions sent to Col. Glenham, to deliver up Newcastle to them, and Col. Glenhams answer to it. With other passages concerning the Sheelds and Tinmouth Castle, and other proceedings made known to Parliament Februarie 12, 1644. By Col. Curfet, Commander in the Scots armie.
titleStmt.author: Curfet, Colonel.

publicationStmt.publisher: Prin-ed [sic] for Andrew Coe, according to order,

notesStmt.note: Annotation on Thomason copy: 1644 in title crossed out and altered to "1643"; V in imprint date crossed out and altered to "1643".
Reproduction of the original in the British Library.
